page.title: 06A NEW HALL FOR CRUDWELL
page.content: In 1983 village people began to propose that{a new village hall}should be built.It was felt that{the existing {hall was not big enough}and also as there is only one room it is only possible for one thing to take place at a time.The{lack of parking {facilities}makes it very dangerous especially at playgroup time.Fund raising started in 1984 and so far{a {total of Â£3,600 has been reached.}This has been from a variety of sources, including a very successful{donkey {derby}held in June 1985 and a{dance run by the Women's Institute.The position of grants is being investigated by a small committee and charity status will be sought.The present{total cost of a new hall is {about Â£65,000.}It is hoped that the new hall will include facilities for sports such as badminton.
